text: this type work tenderloin salad has lots
of fresh herbs ginger and lime juice
it's both hearty and light at the same
time for the pork I wanted to make sure
that the marinade had a lot of flavor
because pork is really mild so this just
gives it the boldness that it needs I'm
using fish sauce and lime juice some
ginger some cilantro garlic a little bit
of sugar and some soy i marinate this
meat overnight in the fridge but if
you're pressed for time you could just
let it sit on the counter for about 30
minutes before you boil it it's
important not to overcook pork
tenderloin because it goes from juicy to
dry in a split second so get your
broiler nice and hot and then just broil
it until it reaches 135 that will keep
it juicy
I wanted to serve this room temperature
so after I pulled the pork from the
broiler I just let it rest and that's
when I made the salad this salad has
cabbage herbs scallion cucumbers bell
pepper peanuts and coconut and a mess it
for the vegetables but now you need lots
of fresh herbs the more the better
because they just add a great pungent
flavor to the whole thing one of my
favorite techniques is to use some of
the marinade as a dressing other than
the pork and the vegetables to just give
this dish a little more complexity I
like to garnish it with some chopped
nuts you can use peanuts you can use
cashews and then toasted coconut flakes
they add texture and they also add
richness this is such a great dish to
make on a weeknight because it comes
together really quickly but it's
beautiful enough to serve to guests
Oh
